file.content:
#!/usr/bin/env bash
# Full first-time setup:
#   1. Verify Python 3.9+
#   2. Create a virtualenv on macOS
#   3. Install all pip dependencies from requirements.txt
#   4. Prompt for API keys (skipped when .env already exists)
set -e

SCRIPT_DIR="$(cd "$(dirname "$0")" && pwd)"
REPO_ROOT="$(cd "$SCRIPT_DIR/.." && pwd)"

# ── 1. Python check ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
PYTHON_BIN=""
for cmd in python3 python; do
  if command -v "$cmd" &>/dev/null; then
    ver=$("$cmd" -c "import sys; print(f'{sys.version_info.major}.{sys.version_info.minor}')" 2>/dev/null || true)
    major="${ver%%.*}"
    minor="${ver##*.}"
    if [ "${major:-0}" -ge 3 ] && [ "${minor:-0}" -ge 9 ]; then
      PYTHON_BIN="$cmd"
      break
    fi
  fi
done

if [ -z "$PYTHON_BIN" ]; then
  echo ""
  echo "Error: Python 3.9+ is required but not found."
  echo "  Install it from https://www.python.org/downloads/"
  exit 1
fi

echo "Python : $($PYTHON_BIN --version)"

# ── 2. macOS: create virtualenv ───────────────────────────────────────────────
OS="$(uname -s)"
VENV_DIR="$REPO_ROOT/.venv"
PIP_BIN="$(command -v pip3 || command -v pip || echo pip)"

if [ "$OS" = "Darwin" ]; then
  echo "macOS  : detected"
  if [ ! -d "$VENV_DIR" ]; then
    echo "venv   : creating at .venv …"
    "$PYTHON_BIN" -m venv "$VENV_DIR"
    echo "venv   : created"
  else
    echo "venv   : .venv already exists"
  fi
  PYTHON_BIN="$VENV_DIR/bin/python"
  PIP_BIN="$VENV_DIR/bin/pip"
fi

# ── 3. Install all pip dependencies ───────────────────────────────────────────
REQUIREMENTS="$REPO_ROOT/requirements.txt"
echo "deps   : installing from requirements.txt …"
"$PIP_BIN" install -r "$REQUIREMENTS" --quiet
echo "deps   : installed"

# ── 4. Ensure notebooks directory exists ──────────────────────────────────────
NOTEBOOKS_DIR="$REPO_ROOT/notebooks"
if [ ! -d "$NOTEBOOKS_DIR" ]; then
  mkdir -p "$NOTEBOOKS_DIR"
  echo "dir    : notebooks/ created"
else
  echo "dir    : notebooks/ already exists"
fi

# ── 5. API key setup (skipped when .env already exists) ───────────────────────
ENV_FILE="$REPO_ROOT/.env"

if [ -f "$ENV_FILE" ]; then
  echo ".env   : exists — skipping key setup (edit manually to update keys)"
  # Backfill MLFLOW_TRACKING_URI if it was added in a later version of setup.
  if ! grep -q "MLFLOW_TRACKING_URI" "$ENV_FILE"; then
    printf "\n# MLflow tracking server\nMLFLOW_TRACKING_URI=http://127.0.0.1:5000\n" >> "$ENV_FILE"
    echo ".env   : MLFLOW_TRACKING_URI added"
  fi
  exit 0
fi

echo ""
echo "┌──────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐"
echo "│  First-time setup: configure your API keys           │"
echo "│  Keys are stored in .env (gitignored).               │"
echo "└──────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘"
echo ""

while true; do
  printf "HuggingFace token  (https://huggingface.co/settings/tokens): "
  read -r HF_TOKEN
  [ -n "$HF_TOKEN" ] && break
  echo "  Error: HuggingFace token is required."
done

while true; do
  printf "Anthropic API key  (https://console.anthropic.com/settings/keys): "
  read -r ANTHROPIC_API_KEY
  [ -n "$ANTHROPIC_API_KEY" ] && break
  echo "  Error: Anthropic API key is required."
done

cat > "$ENV_FILE" <<EOF
# Auto-generated by make install — edit freely.
HF_TOKEN=${HF_TOKEN}
ANTHROPIC_API_KEY=${ANTHROPIC_API_KEY}

# Default provider and model (overridable via make cli PROVIDER=... MODEL=...)
PROVIDER=claude
MODEL=claude-opus-4-6

# MLflow tracking server
MLFLOW_TRACKING_URI=http://127.0.0.1:5000
EOF

echo ""
echo ".env   : created. You're all set!"

content.content:
1→# ── Defaults (override on the command line) ───────────────────────────────────
     2→PROVIDER     ?= claude
     3→MODEL        ?= claude-opus-4-6
     4→URL          ?=
     5→JUPYTER_PORT ?= 8888
     6→
     7→# Prepend .venv/bin when it exists (created on macOS by make install).
     8→# All targets that invoke Python tools pick up venv binaries automatically.
     9→VENV_BIN := $(shell [ -d .venv ] && echo "$(PWD)/.venv/bin:" || echo "")
    10→export PATH := $(VENV_BIN)$(PATH)
    11→
    12→.PHONY: help install start stop cli
    13→
    14→.DEFAULT_GOAL := help
    15→
    16→# ── help ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
    17→help:
    18→	@echo ""
    19→	@echo "Usage:"
    20→	@echo "  make install                       Set up Python, install deps, configure API keys"
    21→	@echo "  make start                         Start Jupyter and MLflow, open in browser"
    22→	@echo "  make stop                          Stop Jupyter and MLflow"
    23→	@echo "  make cli URL=https://...           Generate a Python CLI from a docs URL"
    24→	@echo ""
    25→	@echo "Parameters for make cli (with defaults):"
    26→	@echo "  PROVIDER=$(PROVIDER)   claude | hf"
    27→	@echo "  MODEL=$(MODEL)"
    28→	@echo "  URL=$(URL)"
    29→	@echo "  JUPYTER_PORT=$(JUPYTER_PORT)"
    30→	@echo ""
    31→	@echo "Examples:"
    32→	@echo "  make cli URL=https://docs.anthropic.com/en/api/messages"
    33→	@echo "  make cli URL=https://huggingface.co/docs/hub/api PROVIDER=hf MODEL=mistralai/Mistral-7B-Instruct-v0.3"
    34→	@echo ""
    35→
    36→# ── install ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
    37→## Check Python, create venv, install dependencies + Jupyter, create notebooks/,
    38→## and prompt for HuggingFace / Anthropic API keys (skipped when .env exists).
    39→install:
    40→	@chmod +x scripts/setup.sh
    41→	@bash scripts/setup.sh
    42→	@echo ""
    43→	@echo "All done. Run 'make start' to launch Jupyter and MLflow."
    44→
    45→# ── start ─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
    46→## Launch Jupyter and MLflow in the background and open them in your browser.
    47→start:
    48→	@[ -f .env ] || { echo "Run 'make install' first to install dependencies and configure API keys."; exit 1; }
    49→	@mkdir -p notebooks
    50→	@set -a && . ./.env && set +a && \
    51→	  nohup jupyter notebook --port $(JUPYTER_PORT) --notebook-dir notebooks > .jupyter.log 2>&1 & echo $$! > .jupyter.pid
    52→	@echo "Jupyter  : starting on port $(JUPYTER_PORT) … (log: .jupyter.log)"
    53→	@set -a && . ./.env && set +a && \
    54→	  nohup mlflow server --host 127.0.0.1 --port 5000 > .mlflow.log 2>&1 & echo $$! > .mlflow.pid
    55→	@echo "MLflow   : starting at http://127.0.0.1:5000 … (log: .mlflow.log)"
    56→	@sleep 2
    57→	@open http://localhost:$(JUPYTER_PORT) 2>/dev/null || \
    58→	  xdg-open http://localhost:$(JUPYTER_PORT) 2>/dev/null || \
    59→	  echo "Open http://localhost:$(JUPYTER_PORT) in your browser."
    60→	@open http://127.0.0.1:5000 2>/dev/null || \
    61→	  xdg-open http://127.0.0.1:5000 2>/dev/null || true
    62→
    63→# ── stop ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
    64→## Stop Jupyter and MLflow servers.
    65→stop:
    66→	@PID=""; \
    67→	[ -f .jupyter.pid ] && PID=$$(cat .jupyter.pid); \
    68→	if [ -n "$$PID" ] && kill "$$PID" 2>/dev/null; then \
    69→	  echo "Jupyter  : stopped (PID $$PID)."; rm -f .jupyter.pid; \
    70→	elif pkill -f "jupyter.*notebook" 2>/dev/null; then \
    71→	  echo "Jupyter  : process killed."; rm -f .jupyter.pid; \
    72→	else \
    73→	  echo "Jupyter  : no server found."; \
    74→	fi
    75→	@PID=""; \
    76→	[ -f .mlflow.pid ] && PID=$$(cat .mlflow.pid); \
    77→	if [ -n "$$PID" ] && kill "$$PID" 2>/dev/null; then \
    78→	  echo "MLflow   : stopped (PID $$PID)."; rm -f .mlflow.pid; \
    79→	elif pkill -f "mlflow.*server" 2>/dev/null; then \
    80→	  echo "MLflow   : process killed."; rm -f .mlflow.pid; \
    81→	else \
    82→	  echo "MLflow   : no server found."; \
    83→	fi
    84→
    85→# ── cli ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
    86→## Generate a Python CLI tool from a documentation URL.
    87→## Usage: make cli URL=https://... [PROVIDER=claude|hf] [MODEL=model-name]
    88→cli:
    89→	@[ -f .env ] || { echo "Run 'make install' first to install dependencies and configure API keys."; exit 1; }
    90→ifndef URL
    91→	$(error URL is required. Usage: make cli URL=https://... [PROVIDER=claude|hf] [MODEL=model-name])
    92→endif
    93→	@echo ""
    94→	@echo "Provider : $(PROVIDER)"
    95→	@echo "Model    : $(MODEL)"
    96→	@echo "URL      : $(URL)"
    97→	@echo ""
    98→	@set -a && . ./.env && set +a && \
    99→	  PROVIDER=$(PROVIDER) MODEL=$(MODEL) URL=$(URL) \
   100→	  papermill notebooks/0_generate_cli.ipynb \
   101→	    /tmp/cli_out_$$(date +%s).ipynb \
   102→	    -p PROVIDER "$(PROVIDER)" \
   103→	    -p MODEL    "$(MODEL)" \
   104→	    -p URL      "$(URL)"
   105→

<system-reminder>

But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.
</system-reminder>

content.thinking:
Now I have a clear picture. The `setup.sh` script does:
1. Python version check
2. macOS venv creation
3. Install pip dependencies
4. Ensure notebooks/ directory exists
5. API key setup

The refactoring request is to split this into `setup_jupyter.sh` and `setup_mlflow.sh`. Let me think about what belongs where:

- `setup_jupyter.sh`: Python check, venv creation, pip install, notebooks directory creation, API key setup (since Jupyter needs HuggingFace and Anthropic keys)
- `setup_mlflow.sh`: MLflow-specific setup - the MLFLOW_TRACKING_URI backfill portion, and maybe checking MLflow is installed


- `setup_jupyter.sh` should handle the Python check, venv setup, pip install, notebooks directory, and prompts for the Jupyter-specific keys (HF_TOKEN and ANTHROPIC_API_KEY)
- `setup_mlflow.sh` should be dedicated to just the MLFLOW_TRACKING_URI configuration in .env
- The main `setup.sh` or Makefile `install` target would orchestrate both scripts in sequence

.

I'm settling on splitting this into two focused scripts: `setup_jupyter.sh` handles the Python environment, virtual environment, dependencies, notebooks directory, and API key prompts, while `setup_mlflow.sh` manages the MLflow tracking URI configuration. Then `setup.sh` acts as the orchestrator calling both in order. setup (MLFLOW_TRACKING_URI)

But the `setup_mlflow.sh` would be very thin. Perhaps the split is different:

Looking at the original script:
- Steps 1-4 (Python, venv, deps, notebooks dir) → `setup_jupyter.sh`
- Step 5 (.env setup including MLFLOW_TRACKING_URI) → needs to be split, OR the .env setup logic is in `setup_jupyter.sh` and `setup_mlflow.sh` just handles the MLflow tracking URI part

Actually, looking at the Makefile's `start` target, it launches both Jupyter and MLflow. The setup script sets up the environment for both. So a natural split could be:

`setup_jupyter.sh` handles the Python environment setup plus prompts for HF_TOKEN and ANTHROPIC_API_KEY to write into .env, while `setup_mlflow.sh` focuses on the MLFLOW_TRACKING_URI configuration. Then `setup.sh` orchestrates both scripts. The tricky part is managing the .env file creation—I need to make sure `setup_jupyter.sh` creates it on first run, and `setup_mlflow.sh` appends to it without duplicating logic. Writing the setup script... Setting up the pip binary path and checking for macOS to create a virtual environment if needed, then switching to use the venv's Python and pip binaries for the rest of the setup.

Installing dependencies from requirements.txt, then ensuring the notebooks directory exists, and finally checking if a .env file is already present to skip API key setup if it's been configured before.

Now I'm prompting the user to enter their HuggingFace and Anthropic API keys interactively, with validation to ensure they're not left blank.

Writing setup scripts... Writing orchestration script...

content.text:
Now I have a clear picture. I'll split `setup.sh` into:
- `setup_jupyter.sh` — Python check, venv, deps, notebooks dir, API keys (.env)
- `setup_mlflow.sh` — MLFLOW_TRACKING_URI in .env
- `setup.sh` becomes a thin orchestrator calling both

input.content:
#!/usr/bin/env bash
# Jupyter environment setup:
#   1. Verify Python 3.9+
#   2. Create a virtualenv on macOS
#   3. Install all pip dependencies from requirements.txt
#   4. Ensure notebooks/ directory exists
#   5. Prompt for API keys (skipped when .env already exists)
set -e

SCRIPT_DIR="$(cd "$(dirname "$0")" && pwd)"
REPO_ROOT="$(cd "$SCRIPT_DIR/.." && pwd)"

# ── 1. Python check ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
PYTHON_BIN=""
for cmd in python3 python; do
  if command -v "$cmd" &>/dev/null; then
    ver=$("$cmd" -c "import sys; print(f'{sys.version_info.major}.{sys.version_info.minor}')" 2>/dev/null || true)
    major="${ver%%.*}"
    minor="${ver##*.}"
    if [ "${major:-0}" -ge 3 ] && [ "${minor:-0}" -ge 9 ]; then
      PYTHON_BIN="$cmd"
      break
    fi
  fi
done

if [ -z "$PYTHON_BIN" ]; then
  echo ""
  echo "Error: Python 3.9+ is required but not found."
  echo "  Install it from https://www.python.org/downloads/"
  exit 1
fi

echo "Python : $($PYTHON_BIN --version)"

# ── 2. macOS: create virtualenv ───────────────────────────────────────────────
OS="$(uname -s)"
VENV_DIR="$REPO_ROOT/.venv"
PIP_BIN="$(command -v pip3 || command -v pip || echo pip)"

if [ "$OS" = "Darwin" ]; then
  echo "macOS  : detected"
  if [ ! -d "$VENV_DIR" ]; then
    echo "venv   : creating at .venv …"
    "$PYTHON_BIN" -m venv "$VENV_DIR"
    echo "venv   : created"
  else
    echo "venv   : .venv already exists"
  fi
  PYTHON_BIN="$VENV_DIR/bin/python"
  PIP_BIN="$VENV_DIR/bin/pip"
fi

# ── 3. Install all pip dependencies ───────────────────────────────────────────
REQUIREMENTS="$REPO_ROOT/requirements.txt"
echo "deps   : installing from requirements.txt …"
"$PIP_BIN" install -r "$REQUIREMENTS" --quiet
echo "deps   : installed"

# ── 4. Ensure notebooks directory exists ──────────────────────────────────────
NOTEBOOKS_DIR="$REPO_ROOT/notebooks"
if [ ! -d "$NOTEBOOKS_DIR" ]; then
  mkdir -p "$NOTEBOOKS_DIR"
  echo "dir    : notebooks/ created"
else
  echo "dir    : notebooks/ already exists"
fi

# ── 5. API key setup (skipped when .env already exists) ───────────────────────
ENV_FILE="$REPO_ROOT/.env"

if [ -f "$ENV_FILE" ]; then
  echo ".env   : exists — skipping key setup (edit manually to update keys)"
  exit 0
fi

echo ""
echo "┌──────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐"
echo "│  First-time setup: configure your API keys           │"
echo "│  Keys are stored in .env (gitignored).               │"
echo "└──────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘"
echo ""

while true; do
  printf "HuggingFace token  (https://huggingface.co/settings/tokens): "
  read -r HF_TOKEN
  [ -n "$HF_TOKEN" ] && break
  echo "  Error: HuggingFace token is required."
done

while true; do
  printf "Anthropic API key  (https://console.anthropic.com/settings/keys): "
  read -r ANTHROPIC_API_KEY
  [ -n "$ANTHROPIC_API_KEY" ] && break
  echo "  Error: Anthropic API key is required."
done

cat > "$ENV_FILE" <<EOF
# Auto-generated by make install — edit freely.
HF_TOKEN=${HF_TOKEN}
ANTHROPIC_API_KEY=${ANTHROPIC_API_KEY}

# Default provider and model (overridable via make cli PROVIDER=... MODEL=...)
PROVIDER=claude
MODEL=claude-opus-4-6
EOF

echo ""
echo ".env   : created."

# Jupyter environment setup:
#   1. Verify Python 3.9+
#   2. Create a virtualenv on macOS
#   3. Install all pip dependencies from requirements.txt
#   4. Ensure notebooks/ directory exists
#   5. Prompt for API keys (skipped when .env already exists)
set -e

REPO_ROOT="$(cd "$SCRIPT_DIR/.." && pwd)"

# ── 1. Python check ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
PYTHON_BIN=""
for cmd in python3 python; do
  if command -v "$cmd" &>/dev/null; then
    ver=$("$cmd" -c "import sys; print(f'{sys.version_info.major}.{sys.version_info.minor}')" 2>/dev/null || true)
    major="${ver%%.*}"
    minor="${ver##*.}"
    if [ "${major:-0}" -ge 3 ] && [ "${minor:-0}" -ge 9 ]; then
      PYTHON_BIN="$cmd"
      break
    fi
  fi
done

if [ -z "$PYTHON_BIN" ]; then
  echo ""
  echo "Error: Python 3.9+ is required but not found."
  echo "  Install it from https://www.python.org/downloads/"
  exit 1
fi

echo "Python : $($PYTHON_BIN --version)"

# ── 2. macOS: create virtualenv ───────────────────────────────────────────────
OS="$(uname -s)"
VENV_DIR="$REPO_ROOT/.venv"
PIP_BIN="$(command -v pip3 || command -v pip || echo pip)"

if [ "$OS" = "Darwin" ]; then
  echo "macOS  : detected"
  if [ ! -d "$VENV_DIR" ]; then
    echo "venv   : creating at .venv …"
    "$PYTHON_BIN" -m venv "$VENV_DIR"
    echo "venv   : created"
  else
    echo "venv   : .venv already exists"
  fi
  PYTHON_BIN="$VENV_DIR/bin/python"
  PIP_BIN="$VENV_DIR/bin/pip"
fi

# ── 3. Install all pip dependencies ───────────────────────────────────────────
REQUIREMENTS="$REPO_ROOT/requirements.txt"
echo "deps   : installing from requirements.txt …"
"$PIP_BIN" install -r "$REQUIREMENTS" --quiet
echo "deps   : installed"

# ── 4. Ensure notebooks directory exists ──────────────────────────────────────
NOTEBOOKS_DIR="$REPO_ROOT/notebooks"
if [ ! -d "$NOTEBOOKS_DIR" ]; then
  mkdir -p "$NOTEBOOKS_DIR"
  echo "dir    : notebooks/ created"
else
  echo "dir    : notebooks/ already exists"
fi

# ── 5. API key setup (skipped when .env already exists) ───────────────────────
ENV_FILE="$REPO_ROOT/.env"

if [ -f "$ENV_FILE" ]; then
  echo ".env   : exists — skipping key setup (edit manually to update keys)"
  exit 0
fi

echo ""
echo "┌──────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐"
echo "│  First-time setup: configure your API keys           │"
echo "│  Keys are stored in .env (gitignored).               │"
echo "└──────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘"
echo ""

while true; do
  printf "HuggingFace token  (https://huggingface.co/settings/tokens): "
  read -r HF_TOKEN
  [ -n "$HF_TOKEN" ] && break
  echo "  Error: HuggingFace token is required."
done

while true; do
  printf "Anthropic API key  (https://console.anthropic.com/settings/keys): "
  read -r ANTHROPIC_API_KEY
  [ -n "$ANTHROPIC_API_KEY" ] && break
  echo "  Error: Anthropic API key is required."
done

cat > "$ENV_FILE" <<EOF
# Auto-generated by make install — edit freely.
HF_TOKEN=${HF_TOKEN}
ANTHROPIC_API_KEY=${ANTHROPIC_API_KEY}

# Default provider and model (overridable via make cli PROVIDER=... MODEL=...)
PROVIDER=claude
MODEL=claude-opus-4-6
EOF

echo ""
echo ".env   : created."

input.content:
#!/usr/bin/env bash
# MLflow environment setup:
#   1. Ensure MLFLOW_TRACKING_URI is present in .env
set -e

SCRIPT_DIR="$(cd "$(dirname "$0")" && pwd)"
REPO_ROOT="$(cd "$SCRIPT_DIR/.." && pwd)"

ENV_FILE="$REPO_ROOT/.env"

if [ ! -f "$ENV_FILE" ]; then
  echo ".env   : not found — run setup_jupyter.sh first"
  exit 1
fi

if ! grep -q "MLFLOW_TRACKING_URI" "$ENV_FILE"; then
  printf "\n# MLflow tracking server\nMLFLOW_TRACKING_URI=http://127.0.0.1:5000\n" >> "$ENV_FILE"
  echo ".env   : MLFLOW_TRACKING_URI added"
else
  echo ".env   : MLFLOW_TRACKING_URI already set"
fi

toolUseResult.originalFile:
#!/usr/bin/env bash
# Full first-time setup:
#   1. Verify Python 3.9+
#   2. Create a virtualenv on macOS
#   3. Install all pip dependencies from requirements.txt
#   4. Prompt for API keys (skipped when .env already exists)
set -e

SCRIPT_DIR="$(cd "$(dirname "$0")" && pwd)"
REPO_ROOT="$(cd "$SCRIPT_DIR/.." && pwd)"

# ── 1. Python check ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
PYTHON_BIN=""
for cmd in python3 python; do
  if command -v "$cmd" &>/dev/null; then
    ver=$("$cmd" -c "import sys; print(f'{sys.version_info.major}.{sys.version_info.minor}')" 2>/dev/null || true)
    major="${ver%%.*}"
    minor="${ver##*.}"
    if [ "${major:-0}" -ge 3 ] && [ "${minor:-0}" -ge 9 ]; then
      PYTHON_BIN="$cmd"
      break
    fi
  fi
done

if [ -z "$PYTHON_BIN" ]; then
  echo ""
  echo "Error: Python 3.9+ is required but not found."
  echo "  Install it from https://www.python.org/downloads/"
  exit 1
fi

echo "Python : $($PYTHON_BIN --version)"

# ── 2. macOS: create virtualenv ───────────────────────────────────────────────
OS="$(uname -s)"
VENV_DIR="$REPO_ROOT/.venv"
PIP_BIN="$(command -v pip3 || command -v pip || echo pip)"

if [ "$OS" = "Darwin" ]; then
  echo "macOS  : detected"
  if [ ! -d "$VENV_DIR" ]; then
    echo "venv   : creating at .venv …"
    "$PYTHON_BIN" -m venv "$VENV_DIR"
    echo "venv   : created"
  else
    echo "venv   : .venv already exists"
  fi
  PYTHON_BIN="$VENV_DIR/bin/python"
  PIP_BIN="$VENV_DIR/bin/pip"
fi

# ── 3. Install all pip dependencies ───────────────────────────────────────────
REQUIREMENTS="$REPO_ROOT/requirements.txt"
echo "deps   : installing from requirements.txt …"
"$PIP_BIN" install -r "$REQUIREMENTS" --quiet
echo "deps   : installed"

# ── 4. Ensure notebooks directory exists ──────────────────────────────────────
NOTEBOOKS_DIR="$REPO_ROOT/notebooks"
if [ ! -d "$NOTEBOOKS_DIR" ]; then
  mkdir -p "$NOTEBOOKS_DIR"
  echo "dir    : notebooks/ created"
else
  echo "dir    : notebooks/ already exists"
fi

# ── 5. API key setup (skipped when .env already exists) ───────────────────────
ENV_FILE="$REPO_ROOT/.env"

if [ -f "$ENV_FILE" ]; then
  echo ".env   : exists — skipping key setup (edit manually to update keys)"
  # Backfill MLFLOW_TRACKING_URI if it was added in a later version of setup.
  if ! grep -q "MLFLOW_TRACKING_URI" "$ENV_FILE"; then
    printf "\n# MLflow tracking server\nMLFLOW_TRACKING_URI=http://127.0.0.1:5000\n" >> "$ENV_FILE"
    echo ".env   : MLFLOW_TRACKING_URI added"
  fi
  exit 0
fi

echo ""
echo "┌──────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐"
echo "│  First-time setup: configure your API keys           │"
echo "│  Keys are stored in .env (gitignored).               │"
echo "└──────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘"
echo ""

while true; do
  printf "HuggingFace token  (https://huggingface.co/settings/tokens): "
  read -r HF_TOKEN
  [ -n "$HF_TOKEN" ] && break
  echo "  Error: HuggingFace token is required."
done

while true; do
  printf "Anthropic API key  (https://console.anthropic.com/settings/keys): "
  read -r ANTHROPIC_API_KEY
  [ -n "$ANTHROPIC_API_KEY" ] && break
  echo "  Error: Anthropic API key is required."
done

cat > "$ENV_FILE" <<EOF
# Auto-generated by make install — edit freely.
HF_TOKEN=${HF_TOKEN}
ANTHROPIC_API_KEY=${ANTHROPIC_API_KEY}

# Default provider and model (overridable via make cli PROVIDER=... MODEL=...)
PROVIDER=claude
MODEL=claude-opus-4-6

# MLflow tracking server
MLFLOW_TRACKING_URI=http://127.0.0.1:5000
EOF

echo ""
echo ".env   : created. You're all set!"

content.text:
Done. Here's what changed:

**`scripts/setup_jupyter.sh`** (new) — steps 1–5 from the original:
- Python 3.9+ check
- macOS venv creation
- pip install from `requirements.txt`
- `notebooks/` directory creation
- `.env` creation with `HF_TOKEN`, `ANTHROPIC_API_KEY`, `PROVIDER`, `MODEL`

**`scripts/setup_mlflow.sh`** (new) — MLflow-specific config:
- Ensures `MLFLOW_TRACKING_URI` is present in `.env` (errors if `.env` doesn't exist yet)

**`scripts/setup.sh`** (updated) — thin orchestrator:
- Calls `setup_jupyter.sh` then `setup_mlflow.sh` in sequence

The Makefile's `install` target still calls `bash scripts/setup.sh` unchanged.
